Hi! I’m
Nina Maria

But you can call me Nina.

When I was thirteen years old, I moved back to Brazil with my family to support my grandmother, who was battling ovarian cancer. This was my seventh move so far and I thought it would be just like all the others. But whenever I went to my friends' houses, I noticed something:

Since then, I started a

Since then, I started a Boy Scout troop, began publishing , and became an Innovator (yes, that's my title!) at The Knowledge Society. I taught myself how to code and have a host of ML projects under my belt. I've consuled for companies like Kidogo, which provides high-quality childcare for women in East Africa. Johnathan Smith

I am a...

Community Organizer

I founded one of America's first (and largest!) female Boy Scout Troops. Right now, I lead a school organization to feed the homeless.

Exponential Tech Researcher

I research AI/ML and synthetic biology applications with The Knowledge Society. Stay tuned for my next project!

Writer

I publish two to four articles per month about tech, well-being, and any other nerd-outs in various publications across the Internet.
